description.narrative: The complex emergency in the Kasai region is consequent to violent and daily clashes by opposing militias to DRC national security forces. The ongoing violence is also exacerbating tensions between communities identified as supportive of the militia and those perceived as siding with the government. This has resulted in a large amount of internal displacement and has limited access of some to health care. This project will help provide access to primary health care amongst IDPs.

To achieve the goal of making health care more accessible we will be focusing on 8 areas; Providing 2 emergency medical kits. Provide data collection tools to help document any morbid phenomenon at the 2 health structures. Provide training to 10 nurses and supervisors on the use and disposal of medical equipment, consumables as well as training on the data collection tools. Provide free care for malaria, infectious diseases, anemia, and complications from postpartum hemorrhaging. Assist expectant IDPs with skilled birth attendants. Sensitizing displaced pregnant women on the benefits of Antenatal care Organize at least 6 vaccination sessions for children. Provide weekly formative supervision of activities to support providers in skills acquisition and improve the performance of all activities.
